description: From French trimestre, from Latin trimestris (“of three months”), from trēs (“three”) + mensis (“month”).

entries.meaning: A period of three months or about three months; (financial): quarter.
examples: She is in the second trimester of her first pregnancy.

entries.meaning: One of the terms of an academic year in those learning institutions that divide their teaching in three roughly equal terms, each about three months long. Compare semester.
examples: The school operates on a trimester schedule.
